# HMM Training

## ① Initialization
1. Samples (\(S = 12\)) → divide into \(N\) initial states (evenly)
2. Calculate Avg length of each state  
   (\(l_0, l_1, \ldots, l_N\))
3. Calculate initial transition prob  
   \[   P_{ij} = \frac{1}{l_{ij}}\]
   (\(P_{01}, P_{02}, \ldots, P_{0N}\))
4. Calculate \(\mu, \sigma\) for each state  
   (\(M_0, \ldots, M_N / \sigma_0, \ldots, \sigma_N\))

## ② Loops (\(1, 2, \ldots, t\))
1. For each point (near boundary), compare  
   divide if to move \(x\) to another state  
   \[   \frac{x - \mu_k}{\sigma_k} \quad \text{vs} \quad \frac{x - \mu_{k+1}}{\sigma_{k+1}}\]
2. Calculate Avg length of each state (\(L_1, L_2, \ldots, L_N\))
3. Calculate transition prob (\(P_{11}, P_{12}, \ldots, P_{1N}\))
4. Calculate \(\mu, \sigma\) for each state  
   (\(M_{11}, \ldots, M_{1N} / \sigma_{11}, \ldots, \sigma_{1N}\))

if boundaries don't change => converge!

---

* Note that each state must have \(\geq 1\) point!
